snippet: The I.S.M. index showed the sector shrank for a second consecutive month in July, evidence of a slow-growing economy.
abstract: Institute for Supply Management says its index of manufacturing activity ticked up to 49.8 in July, from 49.7 in June, but a reading below 50 indicates contraction; payroll services provider ADP says private businesses added 163,000 jobs in July; Commerce Dept reports construction spending rose 0.4 percent in June, to a seasonally adjusted annual rate of $842.1 billion, following an upwardly revised 1.6 percent rise in May.
lead_paragraph: The I.S.M. index showed the sector shrank for a second consecutive month in July, evidence of a slow-growing economy.

headline.seo: U.S. Manufacturing Falls for a Second Month
headline.main: Manufacturing Sector Falls for a Second Straight Month
headline.print_headline: Manufacturing Sector Falls for a Second Straight Month
